title.narrative: Strengthening Regional Training Institutues and Expanding Community Access to Quality Family Planning Services through the Population Welfare Department, Punjab & Sindh Provinces

description.narrative: With funding from the David and Lucile Packard Foundation, Pathfinder is implementing a two-year project aimed at improving pre-service trainings at Regional Training Institutes, with focused work at Lahore (Punjab Province) and Hyderabad (Sindh Province). The project harmonizes the efforts to expand and enrich quality family planning/reproductive health services through the government network of family welfare centers in two selected districts Kasur (Punjab) and Khairpur (Sindh) in a cost-effective and sustainable manner. This project is built on Pathfinder’s previous advances and is recognized by the Health and Population Department as part of a consistent and continued contribution for better family health in Pakistan. Since the project’s inception, Pathfinder staff completed a review and revision of the existing training, "Curriculum for Family Welfare Workers." Pathfinder has worked with the Pakistan Nursing Council to incorporated training on healthy timing and spacing and post abortion care developed by Pathfinder into nursing training curriculums.
